description: APPLICATION FOR THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING IN THE REAR GARDEN FOR STORAGE USE.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [insert plans]

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The development hereby permitted shall not be rented, sold independently or occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the main residential use of the dwelling known as 14 Montacute Road Morden SM4 6RL.

Condition : 5 - Removal of PD (Extensions/Alterations/Means of Enclosure) - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the dwellinghouse or the outbuilding or  erection, construction, maintenance, improvement or alteration of a gate, fence, wall or other means of enclosure other than that expressly authorised by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - The water butts illustrated on the drawing hereby approved shall be installed prior to first use of the outbuilding and shall be retained thereafter.

REASON: To safeguard the risk of flooding in the locality in accordance with Local Plan (2024) Policy F15.7 and F15.8.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay.
